p: We next sought to examine the analgesic effect of Tragia involucrata L. leaves using acetic acid-induced writhing test, where oral administration of TIME-4 and TIHE-4 demonstrated anti-nociceptive activity with a significant (p < 0.01) decrease in the number of writhing compared with control (25.40 ± 1.96) ( Figure 3A). TIEAE-4 showed the highest decrease in number of writhing (13.20 ± 1.39; p < 0.001) and increased in the percentage of inhibition (48.03%) ( Figure 3A-B). The standard group also showed a significant reduction (p < 0.001) in the number of writhing compared with control and elevation in the percentage of inhibition ( Figure 3A-B).
